subject: Politics
title: What Is Government
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Is Government usable.

hook.text: Every society creates rules. Government is the system that makes, enforces, and judges them.

buildup.text: From tribal councils to modern states, humans always build institutions to manage group decisions.

discovery.text: Government serves three core roles: keeping order, providing public goods, and protecting rights.

twist.text: Even those who distrust government rely on it. Roads, courts, and currency all need a state.

climax.text: The debate isn't government or no government. It's how much power government should hold.

punchline.text: Government turns collective chaos into shared order.

quiz.question: What are the three core roles of government?
options: Keeping order, providing public goods, and protecting rights
Collecting taxes, waging war, and controlling media
Making money, building roads, and running schools
